result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mackenzie Traghan Mitchell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mackenzie Traghan Mitchell in court. Attorney Angel Johnson appeared in court on behalf of Attorney Amanda Poznanski for Mackenzie Traghan Mitchell.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. For reason stated on the record, Defense requested new date for Plea/Sentencing hearing. State did not object. Parties selected new dates. Case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 2. Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Mackenzie Traghan Mitchell in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court set matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in Court for Status Conference. Court is in trial on another matter and rescheduled this hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mackenzie Traghan Mitchell in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court grants request.  Court orders all future court appearances to be held in person.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mackenzie Traghan Mitchell in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski; both appear by video.  Matthew Zisi appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer J. Byrnes.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.R.C.; 
Mobil Gas Station 525 W. Silver Spring Dr

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Mackenzie Traghan Mitchell in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Mackenzie Traghan Mitchell in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mackenzie Traghan Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
